description.narrative: In November 2012, FCA and its local partner MRDA conducted an assessment on the agriculture sector of Mundri West County. The assessment findings indicated that while an estimated 80% of the people in the area are farmers, the sector depends predominantly on scarce family labour, non-performing local seeds and low soil fertility and that the inputs and investments to agriculture are inadequate and the farming techniques and practices outdated and irresponsive to the food security needs of the households. Se condly, the area is facing shortage of livestock, caused by the systematic looting and slaughtering during conflicts as well as a lack of veterinary services. In addition, the assessment found the state agriculture extension services incapacitated by lack of transport, qualified personnel and means to assists local farmers. As a result of the everlasting conflicts, many people and communities still suffer from trauma. Furthermore, due to lack of marketable skills and high unemployment rate, the idled youth engage in alcohol and drug abuse, which easily resorts to violence. Local, traditional and religious leaders have the potential to play a key role in the well-being and stability of their communities, yet they have limited understanding of trauma, human ri ghts and how the rights should be realised. The overall project objective is to promote communities? recovery and development by enhancing livelihood options and strengthen social cohesion through local customary and other conflict prevention and resolutio n mechanisms.The project consists of two components, under which the specific objectives are1. Agricultural development: to improve food security and income of the targeted households through introducing a business approach to agriculture.? Trainings in ag ro-techniques, including livestock rearing, dairy farming, beekeeping and farming systems as well as efficient land preparation that improve production, productivity and make farming activities attractive to the youth., Granting start-up loans in the form of farming inputs, Provision of extension services and basic farm-business training, Advocate the Western Equatoria ministries of agriculture and education for long-term support for the training activities and extending them into formal agriculture train ing centre.2.
